intro: Mesanthemum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth mesanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in spring, and its fleshy stems help it store water for survival. Mesanthemum glabrum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
